content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a risk-averse person who values security and certainty, I would lean towards the option that provides consistent earnings over time. In this case, choosing 'B' will earn me 40$ per round if my opponent does the same. If my opponent chooses 'R', I will still make more money compared to when I pick 'R' (35$ vs 0$). Over 75 rounds, I can expect a total earnings of 3000$ by consistently choosing 'B'. On the other hand, if my opponent also chooses 'B', I would only earn 2925$. However, since the opponent is anonymous, I cannot be sure they will choose 'B' every time, which increases the risk. Therefore, it seems that choosing 'B' would offer me a higher expected payoff in the long run despite having lower potential earnings per round.

In conclusion, my choice would be {B} to prioritize consistency and security over potential higher earnings with increased risk.
